intro: Campylanthus benthamii var. hirsutus, commonly known as the Hirsute Campylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal and inland desert regions, where it adapts to arid conditions through its succulent-like leaves and deep root system. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
